dcterms:creator: H. Kuehne
A. Arslan
T. Serre
dcterms:description: The Breakfast dataset consists of 1,989 videos of 10 breakfast activities, where one person may perform different activities in different videos. The video qualities vary a lot due to occlusions and different viewpoints.
dcterms:title: Breakfast

dcterms:creator: J.-B. Alayrac
P. Bojanowski
N. Agrawal
J. Sivic
I. Laptev
S. Lacoste-Julien
dcterms:description: INRIA Instruction dataset mainly contains 2-minute long videos collected from YouTube. There are about 47 sub-activities in this dataset. This dataset is very challenging for self-supervised event segmentation approaches, because it carries substantial number of 'background' scenes, which generally do not share obvious common visual patterns.
dcterms:title: INRIA Instructional

dcterms:creator: S. Stein
S. J. McKenna
dcterms:description: 50 Salads dataset collects multi-modal data from the cooking scenarios. In this dataset, the event segmentation is specified at different levels of granularity - high, low and eval. Following previous self-supervised works, we use the 'eval' granularity to train and evaluate our framework.
dcterms:title: 50 Salads

dcterms:creator: W. Kay
J. Carreira
K. Simonyan
B. Zhang
C. Hillier
S. Vijayanarasimhan
F. Viola
T. Green
T. Back
P. Natsev
dcterms:description: Kinetics-GEBD is the newest unconstrained video dataset specifically developed for the evaluation task of generic event boundary detection. It carries the largest number of event boundaries from videos 'in the wild', covering boundaries caused by action changes or generic event changes.
dcterms:title: Kinetics-GEBD
